actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security

official_title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to punish the placing of sexual explicit photographs on the Internet without the permission of the persons photographed.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Personal Pictures Protection Act of 2005 - Amends the Federal criminal code to prohibit placing photographs of a person's sexually explicit conduct on a computer so that they are accessible on the Internet, with the intent to embarrass or cause such person emotional distress and without such person's permission.

titles.title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to punish the placing of sexual explicit photographs on the Internet without the permission of the persons photographed.
